meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: U.S. Sends Sudan a Warning The State Department is sending Deputy Secretary John D. Negroponte to Sudan to deliver another warning on the situation in Darfur, but given a lack of consequences for past warnings, Sudan is unlikely to take heed, critics say.
PAGE A6
N.F.L. Players Suspended The N.F.L. handed out lengthy suspensions to two players who have had repeated off-field legal problems, including a season-long ban for Pacman Jones of the Tennessee Titans.
SPORTSWEDNESDAY, PAGE D1
$400 Million for Columbia Columbia University plans to announce a gift of at least $400 million, one of the largest ever to an American university, from John Werner Kluge, a longtime supporter.
PAGE B1
War-Crime Verdict in Serbia A Serbian court convicted four former paramilitary officers of killing six Bosnian Muslims in 1995, but did not link them to the deaths of 8,000 Muslims in Srebrenica.
PAGE A11
A 'Lost' Work Opens In 1936, the Soviet artists Sergei Prokofiev and Vsevolod Meyerhold began work on ''Boris Godunov.'' It is finally being staged.
PAGE B1
The All-American Brownie The brownie, so modest and easy to make, may be the most decadent way to satisfy the national obsession with chocolate.
DINING, PAGE F1

U.S. Sends Sudan a Warning The State Department is sending Deputy Secretary John D. Negroponte to Sudan to deliver another warning on the situation in Darfur, but given a lack of consequences for past warnings, Sudan is unlikely to take heed, critics say.
PAGE A6
N.F.L. Players Suspended The N.F.L. handed out lengthy suspensions to two players who have had repeated off-field legal problems, including a season-long ban for Pacman Jones of the Tennessee Titans.
SPORTSWEDNESDAY, PAGE D1
$400 Million for Columbia Columbia University plans to announce a gift of at least $400 million, one of the largest ever to an American university, from John Werner Kluge, a longtime supporter.
PAGE B1
War-Crime Verdict in Serbia A Serbian court convicted four former paramilitary officers of killing six Bosnian Muslims in 1995, but did not link them to the deaths of 8,000 Muslims in Srebrenica.
PAGE A11
A 'Lost' Work Opens In 1936, the Soviet artists Sergei Prokofiev and Vsevolod Meyerhold began work on ''Boris Godunov.'' It is finally being staged.
PAGE B1
The All-American Brownie The brownie, so modest and easy to make, may be the most decadent way to satisfy the national obsession with chocolate.
DINING, PAGE F1
